result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald Edward Madison

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Owen Piotrowski appears for the state.  Atty Rick Thomey appears with the defendant, Ronald Madison.
Matters are here at state's request for clarification of counts which were dismissed and read in and counts plead to.  An in-chambers discussion was held and the parties reached the following stipulation which was placed on the record:
AS to case 15CM771, it shall remain as a dismissal.
AS to case 14CM5097, on 6-29-15 counts 3 and 4 were dismissed in error and were to be reinstated prior to the plea on 10-22-2015.  THE COURT ORDERS prior dismissal vacated and COUNTS 3 AND 4 REINSTATED.  Parties are in agreement to allow the plea and sentencing of 10-22-2015 to stand in which counts 1 and 5 were dismissed and read in and the defendant entered guilty pleas to counts 2, 3, and 4 and subsequently sentenced.

Defendant Ronald Edward Madison in court with Attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Peter Hahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Defendant entered a plea on today's date as to Case# 14CM005097.
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders this case DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

Jury trial is vacated.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Richard E. Thomey in court.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant called court to say he was on bus and would get to court as soon as he can.  Court will give defendant until NOON to check in or a bench warrant will be issued.
Defendant appeared at 10:10am and was given next date to appear, 10-28-2015.
LATER, Atty Thomey asked that a plea date of 10-22-2015 be set.  Counsel is to advise defendant of date.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge KREMERS.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Wagner, Br. 38.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Ronald Edward Madison in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case Recalled, 3rd call of the trial. No spin courts available. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.   Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.

Defendant Ronald Edward Madison in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 2nd call of the Jury Trial. Discussion regarding state's ability to proceed in this matter. 
AS TO COUNTS  1 & 2
The state and defense are ready to proceed. Case passed.

Defendant Ronald Edward Madison in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 1st call of jUry Trial. Parties ready to proceed. Case passed to address court calendar.
Received & Filed, State's Motion to Introduce Out-Of-Court Statements.

Defendant Ronald Edward Madison in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Kristin M. Schrank & Mike Schindhelm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final Pretrial held. Parties ready to proceed to trial, neither party requests to address the court on the record. DIscussion placed on the record regarding the state's filings. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Jury Trial at 8:30 am on 06/29/2015.

15RM013040  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
03/10/15

Defendant Ronald Edward Madison in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for a Bail/Bond Hearing. Defendant out of custody, parties no longer wish to address bail. Case addressed off the record.Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. All conditions of bail remain in effect. All motions to be filed, and discovery turned over 20 DAYS in advance of the next court date. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANNETTE A.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ronald Edward Madison in court with attorney John Mathew Krejci.  Defendant Ronald Edward Madison in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
